column4: I am just trying to add a new drive. I first need to run a command to list all my partitions and drives so i can see what the name is to mount it
bloody hell sudo! im used to having root permissions
thank you (and sorry for swearing in here :p)
sudo !! is my best friend recently ;)
sudo -i    might make you happy. sometimes there's no getting around several root commands in a row
then you run fdisk on the device,not the mount point.
earlier I just ran fdisk -l and it showed all drives and all partitions
this is also not mounted. I need to find the partition number to mount it
Sorry, I missed the very beginning, I was sleeping. Can you repeat what you're trying to accomplish?
I think mount shows the valid fs type name strings.
didnt spot it if it was there. Mounted now, just fiddling with fstab :)
you may want to  set uid and gid options on the  mount point
I just  wish  Apple would let me copy the OSX over into a virtual machine on my 'buntu server. :)
im thinking of going the other way. Putting ubuntu on my macbook >.<
Glad to hear its working. Gotta run.
